item.title: Larry add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Larry add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "Better to fight for something than live for nothing." -- George S. Patton

item.title: Larry add a quote by George S. Patton Jr.
item.description: "May God have mercy for my enemies because I won't." -- George S. Patton Jr.

item.title: Larry add a quote by George S. Patton Jr.
item.description: "The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other guy die for his." -- George S. Patton Jr.

item.title: Larry add a quote by ernest hemingway
item.description: "Courage is grace under pressure." -- ernest hemingway

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "So far, about morals, I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Larry add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Larry add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Larry add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or in the holy name of liberty or democracy?" -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Larry add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "You cannot simultaneously prevent and prepare for war." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Larry add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I sincerely believe that banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies, and that the principle of spending money to be paid by posterity, under the name of funding, is but swindling futurity on a large scale." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ben Franklin
item.description: "There was never a bad peace or a good war." -- Ben Franklin

item.title: Larry add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win" -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Larry add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "War and drink are the two things man is never too poor to buy." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Larry add a quote by Herodotus
item.description:
"He asked, 'Croesus, who told you to attack my land and meet me as an enemy instead of a friend?'
The King replied, 'It was caused by your good fate and my bad fate. It was the fault of the Greek gods, who with their arrogance, encouraged me to march onto your lands. <b>Nobody is mad enough to choose war whilst there is peace. During times of peace, the sons bury their fathers, but in war it is the fathers who send their sons to the grave</b>." -- Herodotus

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A government is the most dangerous threat to man's rights: it holds a legal monopoly on the use of physical force against legally disarmed victims." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Larry add a quote by Ayn Rand
Larry add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I swear by my life and my love of it that I will never live for the sake of another man, nor ask another man to live for mine." -- Ayn Rand
